France

Group C | Europe

Onion soup

Don't have a dreamy French footballer to keep you warm at night? No problem - this French classic topped off with a hefty amount of cheese is just as good, if not better.

You'll be shouting Allez les blues! through slurps of this soup all the way out of the Group Stage. With thanks to Nigel Slater for a straightforward take on this soup.

A set of oven-safe soup crocks are needed for this recipe.

  • Time 2hrs
  • Makes 2
  • Difficulty Semi-Pro
  • Units Imperial Metric

Ingredients

  • 40g Butter
    3 tbsp
    40g
    Butter
  • 1 tbsp Olive oil
    1 tbsp
    1 tbsp
    Olive oil
  • 700g Onions
    1 ½ lb
    700g
    Onions thinly sliced
  • 2 tbsp Plain flour
    2 tbsp
    2 tbsp
    Plain flour
  • 1.75 l Beef stock
    7.5 cups
    1.75 l
    Beef stock
  • 120ml White wine
    ½ cup
    120ml
    White wine
  • 2 sprigs Thyme
    2 sprigs
    2 sprigs
    Thyme
  • 5 Baguette
    5
    5
    Baguette sliced diagonally
  • 5 Gruyére cheese
    5
    5
    Gruyére cheese thinly sliced
  • 1
    Over a low heat, melt the butter in a large pan or dutch oven, adding the olive oil so it doesn't burn. Add the onions and cook for 40 minutes until caramelized.
    Coach's tip Keep checking back on the onions to make sure they don't burn
    Coach's tip Keep checking back on the onions to make sure they don't burn
  • 2
    When the onions are on the verge of falling apart add the flour and cook for 5 minutes.
  • 3
    Add beef stock, white wine and thyme. Bring to a simmer and partially cover with a lid for 45 minutes. While the soup is cooking, preheat the oven to 400°F200°C.
  • 4
    When ready, fill oven-safe bowls with the soup, leaving an inch at the top. Place a couple of slices of the baguette, followed by some thin slices of gruyére. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes.
